info.description:
NRLMSISE-00 is an empirical, global reference atmospheric model of the Earth, from ground to space [1]. It models the temperatures and densities of the atmosphere's constituents. A primary use of this model is to aid predictions of satellite orbital decay due to atmospheric drag.

The NRLMSIS-00 empirical atmosphere model was developed by Mike Picone, Alan Hedin, and Doug Drob and is based on the MSISE90 model. See the following refererence for full details including limitations [1] Picone, J. M., et al. NRLMSISE‚Äê00 empirical model of the atmosphere Statistical comparisons and scientific issues, Journal of Geophysical Research Space Physics 107.A12 (2002)

We provide an open RESTful API to the model that wraps the original code which is available here. The API is free but usage is limited to 1000 API calls per day.

Click on a heading below to expand instructions and to try the API.

Amentum Pty Ltd is not responsible nor liable for any loss or damage of any sort incurred as the result of the use of the API.

Copyright Amentum Pty Ltd 2019.
info.title: Atmosphere API - calculate composition and density of the  atmosphere

get.description:
Computes 
Number densities (/cm3) of  He, O, N2, O2, Ar, H, N
Anomalous oxygen number density (/cm3)
Exospheric temperature (K)
Temperature at altitude (K)
Total mass density (g/cm3)
Total mass density is the sum of the masses of the species in  equilibrium at the thermospheric temperature T(z) and the mass  density of the anomalous oxygen component.
get.summary: Computes the MSIS atmospheric parameters for given conditions
tags: Sample the atmosphere under given conditions

get.description:
Computes 
Number density (/cm3) of the species
get.summary: Computes the number density for given species
tags: Sample the number density of a given atmospheric component

AP.description: The Ap-index provides a daily average level for geomagnetic activity F107, F107A, AP effects can be neglected below 80 km.
AP.name: ap

F107.description: Daily flux for previous day (SFU).  F107 and F107A values correspond to  the 10.7 cm radio flux at the actual distance of Earth from Sun  rather than radio flux at 1AU.  F107, F107A, AP effects can be neglected below 80 km.
F107.name: f107

F107A.description: 81 day average of F10.7 flux (SFU).  F107 and F107A values correspond to the 10.7 cm radio flux at the actual distance of Earth from Sun rather than radio flux at 1AU.  F107, F107A, AP effects can be neglected below 80 km.
F107A.name: f107a

Species.description: The atmospheric component as a string.
Species.name: species

UTC.description: Coordinated Universal Time (hrs).  The local time is calculated based on this and the longitude according to the following equation Local time = UTC + Longitude (deg) / 15 (deg) This is approximate and does not account for Equation of Time departures.
UTC.name: utc
